alert.note: Alert for Chambers; Tallapoosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 2:34PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Lee, east central Tallapoosa and southwestern Chambers Counties through 315 PM CDT... At 234 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Waverly, or near Camp Hill, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Camp Hill, Lafayette, La Fayette, Waverly, Chambers County Lake, Sturkie, Oak Bowery, Penton, Ridge Grove, Buffalo, West Chambers and Huguley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
